a.title: Permanent Link to COVID-19 News Update Center

img.alt: Solanco School District - Southern Lancaster County Chamber of ...

p.img: Welcome to the Solanco School District COVID-19 update center. This space will serve as a communication tool between the school district and families in an effort to keep parents, staff, and the entire Solanco community informed on the latest news and resources with regards to the COVID -19 pandemic and its impact on our schools and community.

div.p: We will continue to update this page with news and information relevant to our school district as it becomes available.

p.br:
The last day of the school year for students in kindergarten through grade 11 will be Tuesday, June 9.
The last day for seniors will be Friday, June 5.
Friday, May 8 will be an instructional day.
We will announce plans for commencement as soon as we can. While we have been surveying students and parents about possibilities, we are still analyzing ways to hold a ceremony. We are also still looking at possible dates/times for this. Thank you for your patience in this regard.

div.p: Solanco’s food distribution program is held Monday through Friday, 9 to 11 a.m., in the high school parking lot.

a.title: Permanent Link to PARENT & COMMUNITY RESOURCES DURING COVID-19 CRISIS – RECURSOS PARA PADRES Y LA COMUNIDAD DURANTE LA CRISIS DE COVID-19

strong.a:
PARENT & COMMUNITY RESOURCES DURING COVID-19 CRISIS –
RECURSOS PARA PADRES Y LA COMUNIDAD DURANTE LA CRISIS DE COVID-19

p.strong: IU13 in Lancaster is providing a list of resources available for families during the coronavirus update. The information is available in English and Spanish.

div.p:
From the Solanco School Guidance Department:
If you are in a crisis situation, in danger, or immediately concerned for the safety of another person or yourself, please contact one of the 24-hour emergency numbers below:
Lancaster County Crisis Intervention: 717-394-2631
National Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-TALK (8255)
Suicide Prevention Textline: Text “HELP” to 741741
911 for emergencies other than mental health concerns
211 for needs such as food, shelter, and other supports
If you enjoyed this article, subscribe to receive more just like it.

opportunities to maximize student academic performance in a safe and secure environment"
